name: Sleeping Swan (Pigeon Pose - Yin Style)
setup: Bring right knee forward toward right wrist
Slide right foot toward left wrist (shin parallel to mat edge)
Extend left leg straight behind, top of foot on mat
steps: Walk hands forward and lower torso toward floor
Rest on forearms or fully fold forward (sleeping position)
Use props under front hip if needed for support
Find your edge - moderate sensation in right hip/glute
Hold still for 3-5 minutes (yin yoga timing)
Breathe slowly and deeply, allowing body to relax
Exit slowly: press into hands, slide front leg back, switch sides
cues: Keep front shin as parallel as comfortable
mistakes: Forcing front leg into full parallel position
Twisting hips instead of keeping them square
Collapsing onto front hip without support
safety: Use cushion or block under front hip if needed. Exit slowly after long holds. Stop if you feel knee pain in front leg. This is a yin (passive) pose - never force.

regressions: Keep front shin less parallel (foot closer to hip)
Use block or cushion under front hip
Stay on hands instead of lowering to forearms
progressions: Bring front shin more parallel to mat edge
Lower all the way to floor (sleeping swan)
Add side bend over front leg

prescriptionHints.notes: Deep yin yoga hip opener. Targets glutes and external rotators. Hold still for extended time.

joints.notes: Protect front knee by not forcing shin parallel. Use props generously. Exit slowly after long holds.
